sen.j: 元正天皇（元正天皇）は即位直前に一品を与えられたこと、孝謙天皇の後継者に擬えられた道祖王（廃太子）及び大炊王（淳仁天皇）がいずれも一品親王である新田部親王・舎人親王（いずれも故人）の子であり、陽成天皇の事実上の廃位後に立てられた時康親王（光孝天皇）は当時唯一の一品親王であった。
sen.e: Empress Gensho was granted Ippon just before the enthronment, and Funado no Okimi (the deposed Crown Prince) and Prince Oi (emperor Junnin) who were the sons of Ippon Shinno, Imperial Prince Niitabe and Imperial Prince Toneri (both deceased) were considered as a successor of Emperor Koken, and Imperial Prince Tokiyasu (Emperor Koko) who ascended after emperor Yozei's dethronement was only Ippon Shinno at that time.

sen.e: During the Sekkanseiji Period (the period of Sekkan [regents and advisers] govern the country), most of the emperor's children except children by empresses demoted from nobility to subject; the requirements for conferring Ippon came to emphasized more on their relationship with the emperor and regents, and less on a career in Nihon.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、為平親王や敦康親王のように皇位継承において優位だった親王が皇位を断念せざるを得なくなった代償に授けられるケースが生じた（藤原氏の策動で皇籍に復帰させられた兼明親王（元左大臣源兼明）の一品叙位も近似の例と言える）。
sen.e: There were cases like Imperial Prince Tamehira and Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had the advantage over the succession to the Imperial Throne, but they had to give up and they were granted Ippon as compensation (a case of granting Ippon to Imperial Prince Kaneakira (MINAMOTO no Kaneakira, former Minister of the Left) would be a similar case that he had to return to the Imperial family because of the Fujiwara clan's stratagy).

Also, there were cases such as the Imperial Prince Tamehira and the Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had the advantage over the succession to the Imperial Throne, but they had to give up and they were granted Ippon as a compensation (A case of conferring Ippon to the Imperial Prince Kaneakira [MINAMOTO no Kaneakira, former Minister of the Left] can be said as a similar case that he had to return to the Imperial Family because of the Fujiwara clan's strategy.)
sen.cmt: Also, the, a を補いました。 like→such as と修正しました。カッコ内、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Also, there were cases such as the Imperial Prince Tamehira and the Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had the advantage over the succession to the Imperial Throne, but they had to give up and they were granted Ippon as a compensation (A case of conferring Ippon to the Imperial Prince Kaneakira [MINAMOTO no Kaneakira, former Minister of the Left] can be said as a similar case that he had to return to the Imperial Family because of the Fujiwara clan's strategy.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 特に内親王への一品、とりわけ藤原道長の孫や曾孫に対する叙位が多く見られるようになる（醍醐天皇から後朱雀天皇までの子女のうち一品に叙されたのが男性4名に対して女性9名でうち4名が道長の孫あるいは曾孫にあたる内親王であった）。
sen.e: Granting Ippon to Imperial Princess, particularly grandchildren or great-grandchildren of FUJIWARA no Michinaga increased (Among prince and princess between Emperor Daigo and Emperor Gosuzaku, four princes were granted Ippon, but four out of nine princess were grandchildren or great-grandchildren of Michinaga).

The cases of conferring Ippon to particularly imperial princesses, especially grandchildren or great-grandchildren of FUJIWARA no Michinaga increased (Among the children who were conferred between the Emperor Daigo and the Emperor Gosuzaku, four male per nine female which four within were the imperial princesses of the grandchildren or great-grandchildren of Michinaga.)
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。the, cases, particularly を補いました。Granting→conferring, Imperial Princess→imperial princesses,particularly→especially,prince and princess→children, 文脈に応じてカッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: The cases of conferring Ippon to particularly imperial princesses, especially grandchildren or great-grandchildren of FUJIWARA no Michinaga increased (Among the children who were conferred between the Emperor Daigo and the Emperor Gosuzaku, four male per nine female which four within were the imperial princesses of the grandchildren or great-grandchildren of Michinaga.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: こうして一品親王の重要性は急速に失われていき、天皇・あるいは外戚の庇護を受けた親王・内親王への待遇付与へと変質することになった。
sen.e: In this way, the importance of Ippon Shinno began decreasing leading to changes in rewarding Imperial princes and princesses who were patronaged by the emperor or maternal relatives.

In this way, the importance of Ippon Shinno rapidly disappeared, and transformed to the treatment allowance to the imperial princes and princesses who were patronized by the emperor or maternal relatives.
sen.cmt: began decreasing→rapidly disappeared,文半ばより、文脈に応じてスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: In this way, the importance of Ippon Shinno rapidly disappeared, and transformed to the treatment allowance to the imperial princes and princesses who were patronized by the emperor or maternal relatives.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
